turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Thymidine.
turn.2: Thymidine  Thymidine (deoxythymidine; other names deoxyribosylthymine, thymine deoxyriboside) is a pyrimidine deoxynucleoside.
turn.4: Deoxythymidine is the DNA nucleoside T, which pairs with deoxyadenosine (A) in double-stranded DNA.
turn.6: In cell biology it is used to synchronize the cells in G1/early S phase.
turn.7: What are some other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Before the boom in thymidine use caused by the need for thymidine in the production of the antiretroviral drug azidothymidine (AZT), much of the world's thymidine production came from herring sperm.
turn.10: Thymidine occurs almost exclusively in DNA but it also occurs in the T-loop of tRNA.
turn.12: In its composition, deoxythymidine is a nucleoside composed of deoxyribose (a pentose sugar) joined to the pyrimidine base thymine.
